Welcome to the Artist Price Calculator. The app will help you calculate pricing on your artwork and allows you to not only price materials and labor but also to factor in overhead costs such as studio space, marketing & packaging. You will also find help screens along with way. You can change your costing estimates at any time and price multiple items quickly and on the fly.

To calculate studio costs, Enter your monthly rent, utilities, maintenance and anything else that is related to your making space. For home studios, measure your studio to calculate your square footage and divide into the total square footage of your home. This will provide you with a percentage. Then you can calculate the share of your mortgage & utilities based on that percentage. The final step of this process is estimating how many pieces you can create each month. This can be an average or even an educated guess to start. To be more accurate, start keeping track of the number of pieces you create each month. The app divides your studio costs by the number of pieces you create per month in order to give you a studio cost per piece. If your studio costs change at any time, revisit your preferences here and change your input.

Marketing costs can be calculated similarly to studio costs. So, consider what you spend on advertising per month. This can include print advertising, your email subscription service, Facebook and Instagram ads, or printing costs for flyers or postcards. You may not advertise every month, or those costs may change from month to month, so try to average the costs over twelve months to give you the amount you will use in this calculation. In the Studio Costs section, you recorded the number of pieces you make per month. Use that number again here.
